授業目的: This is an introductory course on accounting where students will learn to use accounting information for making economic decisions. The course objective will be achieved by introducing the concepts and issues of financial accounting with an emphasis on how the economic events of an organization are identified, measured, processed, and communicated to a wide variety of users.
到達目標: Upon successful completion of the requirements for this course, students will be able to: a)Understand and use accounting as an information system for measuring, processing and communicating information that is useful in making economic decisionsb)Comprehend the conceptual framework of financial accounting including GAAP, IFRS, and IASBc)Identify the accounting cycle required to prepare and use of accounting statementsd)Understand the technical competencies as well as underlying rationale for accounting practices and the effectiveness of these practices
関連科目: The course has no specific prerequisites.
授業の概要・背景: Throughout your career you may work as a manager, investor, regulator, business analyst or professional accountant. Whatever your role is, you need to understand the financial accounting to use accounting information as input to make economic decisions. The course objective will be achieved by introducing the concepts and issues of financial accounting with an emphasis on how the economic events of an organization are identified, measured, processed, and communicated to a wide variety of users.
授業方法:
All lectures are conducted
completely face-to-face. Study materials (i.e., PowerPoint slides, class exercises, and home assignments) will be uploaded to LUNA one week in advance. Students are strongly encouraged to read the materials before joining the class. It would be helpful to note down the key concepts in each chapter to discuss in class. In each session, the instructor will first clarify the key concepts of a chapter to the students. Then, the students will solve several related problems. This process will ensure that the students acquire adequate technical competencies as well as comprehend the underlying rationale and effectiveness of accounting practices. Individual assignments will be from end-of-chapter problems. On average, students should spend 3/4 hours working on each assignment.  The mid-term exam is an in-class evaluation and will be held in the 4th week. The exam is mainly based on Multiple Choice Questions (MCQ).The final written examination will be held face-to-face in the 8th week (in the 2nd period).
